answers.answer: Hi there. I can understand these symptoms must be very disturbing for you. You need to check with a neurologist soon for an MRI spine cervical and lumbar to rule out any spinal canal stenosis,  intervertebral disc prolapsed or any bony spur irritating the nerves. Any other cause for cervical and lumbar nerve compression should be checked. Blood tests to investigate diabetes, thyroid disorders, Vitamin B 12 and B6 deficiencies, any known history of chronic alcohol abuse. Try to reduce your weight with guided nutrition advice and exercise.Once the cause is ascertained you might need correction of deficits, hormonal imbalances and surgical intervention if found guilty.Your neurologist is the best judge because certain things cannot be imagined over intrenet.Take care

question: For 5-6 weeks I have been having the same symptoms, and they have been gettinggradually worse, in no way getting better.  It started with a sometimes numb,sometimes tingling sensation in my left hand's fingers.  It eventually startedto tingle in my lower back, back thighs, and lower legs.  I could not feel anytingling sensation unless I craned my neck downward.  It has gotten to the pointnow where I have a constant tingling sensation in my lower legs, hands andforearms, and when I crane my neck downward it is like a jolt of electricityshoots through my arms, legs, and lower back.  It is twice as bad when I workout/run.  It is not that it is painful, but it is uncomfortable and like nothingIve ever experienced.  And it has gone on for a long time now.  I had a headinjury over the summer that required thirteen staples to close (back of head)and I also contracted mono about a year ago at age 21.  I am now 22 years old,male, and weigh around 200 lbs.
title: Severe tingling sensation gradually spreading
